sentence: You put in strong effort and stay focused, even when the work is challenging.
You take responsibility for your work and follow through consistently.
You show a strong understanding of key ideas and can apply them in new situations.
You explain your thinking clearly, which shows real comprehension.
You contribute positively in class and work well with others.
You listen respectfully and help group work run smoothly.
A next step is building more consistency so your work stays steady from week to week.
Try starting earlier and spreading work out to reduce last-minute stress.
Try asking questions or seeking help sooner when something feels confusing.
Reaching out earlier will help you stay confident and keep making progress.
One helpful habit is checking your work carefully before turning it in, especially on multi-step tasks.
Slow down at the end and do a quick final review to catch small mistakes.
